name: PLAST seminar
body:
For our online communication, we are going to use [slack](https://plast-feb16.slack.com). First you have to be invited, so make sure you have provided a valid email.

### Slides
* [general slides](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/seminar16.ppt)
* [examples + logic](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/datalog_logic.pdf)
* [cclyzer slides](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/cclyzer-intro.pdf)

### Repos
* [Doop repo](https://bitbucket.org/yanniss/doop)
* [Doop Benchmarks repo](https://bitbucket.org/yanniss/doop-benchmarks)
* [cclyzer repo](https://github.com/plast-lab/cclyzer)

### Graph Example
* [declarations](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/graph-decls.logic)
* [facts](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/graph-facts.logic)
* [rules](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/graph.logic)
* [project file](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/graph.project)
* [script](https://github.com/plast-lab/feb16-seminar/raw/gh-pages/material/graph.lb)

If you are not using the project file, issue the following commands:
```bash
bloxbatch -db graph-db -create -overwrite -blocks base
bloxbatch -db graph-db -addBlock -file graph-decls.logic
bloxbatch -db graph-db -execute -file graph-facts.logic
bloxbatch -db graph-db -addBlock -file graph.logic
```

Otherwise, issue the following commands:
```bash
bloxcompiler compileProject graph.project -outDir build
bloxbatch -script graph.lb
```

### Aggregation
The example we tried with aggregation on the results of an analysis from Doop.
```bash
bloxbatch -db last-analysis -query \
'_a(h,v) <- VarPointsTo(_, h, _, v).
_b[v] = cnt <- agg<<cnt = count()>> _a(_, v).
_c[] = m <- agg<<m = max(cnt)>> _b[_] = cnt.
_d(v, cnt) <- _b[v] = cnt, _c[] = cnt.' \
-print _d
```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
